question:
Question: At the initial position, you are asked to navigate to the roof of a building three floors ahead. Is the destination within sight at the current location? If yes, where is the destination in your view?  
choose:  
A. I see the roof of the three-story building ahead in the lower right part of my field of view.  
B. I see the roof of the three-story building ahead in the lower left part of my field of view.  
C. I see the roof of the three-story building ahead in the upper center of my field of view.  
D. I cannot see the roof of the three-story building ahead in my field of view.  
E. I see the roof of the three-story building ahead on the right side of my field of view.

textgrad_result.init_answer: Option: D; Reason: The provided frames show an aerial view of a building and its surroundings, but the perspective is from above rather than a first-person view. Additionally, the images do not depict a first-person navigation scenario where the roof of a three-story building ahead would be within sight at the initial position. Therefore, based on the given context and the nature of the images, the destination (roof of a three-story building) is not visible in the current field of view from this aerial perspective.
textgrad_result.evaluation:
Location: [(0, 18)]
Option: D
Reason: The video shows an aerial view of the building and its surroundings. It is not a first-person perspective. Therefore, it is impossible to determine if the roof of a three-story building ahead is within sight from a first-person perspective at the initial position. The provided answer is correct.
